body: Does screen size/ resolution have an impact on one's aim?
body_tagged: Does screen size/ resolution have an impact on one's aim?
title: Another question

replies.body: To be honest, I think it does.
replies.body_tagged: To be honest, I think it does.

replies.body: Yes, playing on small screen vs full & F11 always makes my aim worse and throws it off. Same with other people I know.
replies.body_tagged: Yes, playing on small screen vs full & F11 always makes my aim worse and throws it off. Same with other people I know.

replies.body: My PC is awful so I currently play in small screen, do you recommend I play in fullscreen with low resolution?
replies.body_tagged: My PC is awful so I currently play in small screen, do you recommend I play in fullscreen with low resolution?

replies.body:
You could lower your render distance, turn down graphics and try fullscreen. Turning off particles can also save you a lot of lag in PvP, but can be annoying to tell when your hits register. 

Also, if you're worried about aim, turn down FoV and dpi. 

I play on 70 (Normal) FoV and 1.1k dpi and I can turn and lock on to people really well. When you turn down your FoV, players appear larger, making it easier to aim at your opponent, technically giving you a larger target to hit.
